briefdescription.para: Digest authentication requested.
Client certificate requested.

Do not use any mechanism to pass through firewalls.
Use the specified public adress.
Use a STUN server to get the public address.
Use the ICE protocol.

Policy to use to pass through firewalls.
Lime is not used at all.
Lime is always used.
Lime is used only if we already shared a secret with remote.

Policy to use to pass through NATs/firewalls.

briefdescription.para: Sets the ports to be used for each of transport (UDP or TCP) A zero value port for a given transport means the transport is not used.

detaileddescription.para:
A value of LC_SIP_TRANSPORT_RANDOM (-1) means the port is to be choosen randomly by the system. A value of LC_SIP_TRANSPORT_DONTBIND (-2) means that the socket will not be bound explicitely, in other words liblinphone won't listen for incoming connections at all. This mode is suitable for a pure client application (ex: a mobile application).
core
LinphoneCore object
transports
A LinphoneSipTransports structure giving the ports to use
0

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the port configuration used for each transport (udp, tcp, tls).

detaileddescription.para:
A zero value port for a given transport means the transport is not used. A value of LC_SIP_TRANSPORT_RANDOM (-1) means the port is to be chosen randomly by the system. A value of LC_SIP_TRANSPORT_DONTBIND (-2) means that the socket will not be bound explicitely, in other words liblinphone won't listen for incoming connections at all. This mode is suitable for a pure client application (ex: a mobile application).
core
LinphoneCore object
A LinphoneTransports structure with the configured ports

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the real port number assigned for each sip transport (udp, tcp, tls).

detaileddescription.para:
A zero value means that the transport is not activated. If LC_SIP_TRANSPORT_RANDOM was passed to linphone_core_set_sip_transports(), the random port choosed by the system is returned.
core
LinphoneCore object
A LinphoneTransports structure with the ports being used

detaileddescription.para:
This function was used to force a given IP address to appear in SDP. Unfortunately, this cannot work as explained by https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc5389#section-2 .

linphone_account_params_set_nat_policy()

briefdescription.para: Artificially cause the relay path to be selected when ICE is used.

detaileddescription.para:
This is mainly a function for test, for example to validate that the relay service (ever TURN or media-aware SIP proxy) is working as expected. Indeed, in many cases a path through host or server reflexive candidate will be found by ICE, which makes difficult to make sure that the relay service is working as expected.
lc
LinphoneCore object
enable
boolean value

briefdescription.para: Indicates whether the ICE relay path is forcibly selected.

simplesect.para: a boolean value indicating whether forced relay is enabled.
linphone_core_enable_forced_ice_relay().

briefdescription.para: Get The policy that is used to pass through NATs/firewalls.

detaileddescription.para:
It may be overridden by a NAT policy for a specific proxy config.
core
LinphoneCore object
LinphoneNatPolicy object in use.
linphone_account_params_get_nat_policy()

briefdescription.para: This method is called by the application to notify the linphone core library when network is reachable.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this method with true trigger linphone to initiate a registration process for all proxies. Calling this method disables the automatic network detection mode. It means you must call this method after each network state changes.

parameterdescription.para: TRUE if network is reachable, FALSE otherwise

briefdescription.para: return network state either as positioned by the application or by linphone itself.

simplesect.para: TRUE if network is reachable, FALSE otherwise

briefdescription.para: This method is called by the application to notify the linphone core library when the SIP network is reachable.

detaileddescription.para: This is for advanced usage, when SIP and RTP layers are required to use different interfaces. Most applications just need linphone_core_set_network_reachable().

parameterdescription.para: TRUE if network is reachable, FALSE otherwise

briefdescription.para: This method is called by the application to notify the linphone core library when the media (RTP) network is reachable.

detaileddescription.para: This is for advanced usage, when SIP and RTP layers are required to use different interfaces. Most applications just need linphone_core_set_network_reachable().

parameterdescription.para: TRUE if network is reachable, FALSE otherwise

briefdescription.para: Sets a TLS certificate used for TLS authentication The certificate won't be stored, you have to set it after each LinphoneCore startup.

the nat v4 address.

briefdescription.para: Set the mandatory v4 IP address to use with this NAT policy as server-reflexive candidate for ICE.

detaileddescription.para:
The IP address is used only if no stun server is set for server-reflexive candidate gathering. Using this method is useful when Liblinphone is used in a server product, when the server does not own the public IP address. Used when STUN or TURN are enabled.
policy
LinphoneNatPolicy object
v4_address
The STUN server to use with this NAT policy.

briefdescription.para: Get the mandatory v6 IP address to use with this NAT policy as server-reflexive candidate for ICE.

detaileddescription.para:
Used when STUN or TURN are enabled.
policy

the nat v4 address.

The IP address is used only if no stun server is set for server-reflexive candidate gathering. Using this method is useful when Liblinphone is used in a server product, when the server does not own the public IP address. Used when STUN or TURN are enabled.
policy
LinphoneNatPolicy object
v4_address
The STUN server to use with this NAT policy.

briefdescription.para: Get the username used to authenticate with the STUN/TURN server.

detaileddescription.para:
The authentication will search for a LinphoneAuthInfo with this username. If it is not set the username of the currently used LinphoneProxyConfig is used to search for a LinphoneAuthInfo.
policy
LinphoneNatPolicy object
The username used to authenticate with the STUN/TURN server.

briefdescription.para: Set the username used to authenticate with the STUN/TURN server.

detaileddescription.para:
The authentication will search for a LinphoneAuthInfo with this username. If it is not set the username of the currently used LinphoneProxyConfig is used to search for a LinphoneAuthInfo.
policy
LinphoneNatPolicy object
username
The username used to authenticate with the STUN/TURN server.
